SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

com.nextpeer.android
Class Nextpeer

java.lang.Object
  com.nextpeer.android.Nextpeer

public final class Nextpeer
extends java.lang.Object

This class manages the entire Nextpeer session. Please see the following online guides for information on the integration process.

Permissions required:

  • permission#INTERNET
    • - Necessary to upload data to the web-service.
Permissions recommended:
  • permission#ACCESS_NETWORK_STATE
    • - Necessary to identify if a connection is available prior to make network requests.'
Basic Usage
  1. In Application#onCreate(), instantiate the Nextpeer.
  2. In Activity#onStart(), call onStart().
  3. In Activity#onStop(), call reportForfeitForCurrentTournament() in case isCurrentlyInTournament() as the user left an on-going tournament.
  4. In NextpeerListener#onTournamentStart(NextpeerTournamentStartData), start your game scene.
  5. In NextpeerListener#onTournamentEnd(NextpeerTournamentStartData), end your game scene and switch back to the main menu scene.
  6. Every score change in the game call reportScoreForCurrentTournament(int)

Method Detail

initialize

public static final void initialize(Context context,
                                    java.lang.String gameKey,
                                    NextpeerListener listener)
Initialize Nextpeer. This will allocate Nextpeer internal structures the first time it's called This must be called before any other Nextpeer methods can be called.

Parameters:
context - The context used to access resources on behalf of the application. You should pass the Context#getApplicationContext() to avoid the potential memory leak incurred by maintaining references to Activity instances. Cannot be null.
gameKey - The game key unique for each game generated at www.nextpeer.com. Cannot be null or empty.
listener - An instance derived from NextpeerListener. Cannot be null or empty.
settings - Lets you customize the way Nextpeer acts. null is OK.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if context is null.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if gameKey is null or empty.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if listener is null.

Starts a new session. This should be called in every Activity#onStart() method.

Warning: Cannot be called before initialize().

public static final boolean isNextpeerSupported()
Call this method to verify if the current run time environment supports Nextpeer requirements.

Note: Minimum Android OS version supported by the SDK is FROYO (API level 8).

Returns:
true if the run time requirements match, false otherwise.

reportScoreForCurrentTournament

public static final void reportScoreForCurrentTournament(int score)
Call this method to report the current score for the tournament. This allows Nextpeer to send various notifications about the players' scores.

Warning: Cannot be called before initialize() and onStart().

Parameters:
score - The current game score to be reported.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if score is negative.

reportControlledTournamentOverWithScore

public static final void reportControlledTournamentOverWithScore(int score)
Call this method when your game manages the current tournament and the player just died (a.k.a. 'Last Man Standing').

Note: The method will act only if the current tournament is from a 'GameControlled' tournament type.

Warning: Cannot be called before initialize() and onStart().

Parameters:
score - The current game score to be reported.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if score is negative.

reportForfeitForCurrentTournament

public static final void reportForfeitForCurrentTournament()
Call this method when the user wishes to exit the current tournament.

Warning: Cannot be called before initialize() and onStart().

pushDataToOtherPlayers

public static final void pushDataToOtherPlayers(byte[] data)
This method is used to push a buffer to the other players. This can potentially be used to create custom notifications or some other interactive mechanism that incorporates the other players. The buffer will be sent to the other players and will activate the NextpeerListener::onReceiveTournamentCustomMessage: method on their listener.

Warning: Cannot be called before initialize() and onStart().

Parameters:
data - The byte array to send to the other connected players.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if data is empty.

unreliablePushDataToOtherPlayers

public static final void unreliablePushDataToOtherPlayers(byte[] data)
This method is used to push a buffer to the other players. Unlike the pushDataToOtherPlayers method, buffers sent through this function are not guaranteed to reach the other players. However, the buffers sent via this method arrive on the other end much more quickly. This can potentially be used notify other players of changes in the game state. The buffer will be sent to the other players and will activate the NextpeerListener::onReceiveUnreliableTournamentCustomMessage: method on their listener.

Warning: Cannot be called before initialize() and onStart().

Parameters:
data - The byte array to send to the other connected players.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if data is empty.

requestRecordingControlScoreModifier

public static final void requestRecordingControlScoreModifier(java.lang.String userId,
                                                              int scoreModifier)
This method is used to change the score modifier for the given recording. Note that the given modifier is added to previous modifiers in order to produce the score for the recording.

Warning: Cannot be called before initialize() and onStart().

Parameters:
userId - player id for the recording.
scoreModifier - a modifier to be added to the score (may be positive or negative).
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if userId is empty or null.

Returns the amount of seconds left for the active time-based tournament.

Note: The method will return 0 if the current tournament is of GameControlled type or in case there is no active tournament.

Warning: Cannot be called before initialize() and onStart().

Returns:
The amount of seconds left for the active tournament.

registerToSynchronizedEvent

public static final void registerToSynchronizedEvent(java.lang.String eventName,
                                                     int timeoutInMilliseconds)
Register to a synchronized event which will be triggered once all connected players register to such event. Nextpeer will trigger a call to NextpeerListener#onReceiveSynchronizedEvent(String, NextpeerSyncEventFire) when the rest of the connected players will register to this synchronized event. For example, you can register for a start game synchronized event. This way, your can be sure that all players will start the game together, without taking into consideration different loading time per device.

Warning: Cannot be called before initialize() and onStart(). In addition cannot be called if the tournament has not started yet. The NextpeerListener::onTournamentStart: method has not called.

Note: An inherent problem with multiplayer games is that each of the players may have devices of different performance. One device may be high-end level while the other may be a slow, old device. This means that the loading time of the tournament may differ for each player. While one device may load a heavy 3D game in one second, the other may load it in 15 seconds. Such a situation would create a bad experience for the player who had to wait for 15 seconds. To accommodate this scenario Nextpeer added an option of defining specific points in the game where the game-play will start regardless if all the players finished loading. Usually, this point would be the starting of the game. This improves user experience to the majority of players and gives greater flexibility for the developers. Players who have not loaded the game on time will still play, but they will start after the other players. Call #registerToSynchronizedEvent() to register a synchronized event which will trigger the NextpeerListener#onReceiveSynchronizedEvent(String,NextpeerSynchronizedEventFire) method once all connected players register to such event.

Parameters:
eventName - The synchronized event name that the clients will register to. Cannot be empty or null. Try to use top down domain. For example, "com.yourcompany.yourgame.syncevent".
timeoutInMilliseconds - The timeout in milliseconds for the synchronized event. Cannot be zero or negative.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if eventName is empty or null.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if timeoutInMilliseconds is zero or negative.

setNextpeerSettings
